title: Skip Customer Sign-In and Open Add Request from Landing

requirements.summary: Change the Landing page Customer Portal button to go directly to the customer Add Request form.
acceptanceCriteria: From route "/", clicking "Access Customer Portal" navigates to "/customer/request".
The intermediate customer sign-in screen is not shown during this flow.

file_operations.description: Update the "Access Customer Portal" button navigation target from "/customer/signin" to "/customer/request".

requirements.summary: Remove the customer sign-in route and update any navigation/redirects that previously sent users to "/customer/signin".
acceptanceCriteria: The route "/customer/signin" is no longer registered in the router.
Any code paths that navigate to "/customer/signin" (e.g., customer session guard behavior) navigate to "/customer/request" instead.
Visiting "/customer/signin" in the browser no longer shows the Customer Sign In screen (it should result in Not Found or redirect to "/customer/request" per the updated routing).

file_operations.description: Remove the "/customer/signin" route registration from the router and remove the unused import of CustomerSignInPage so the sign-in screen cannot be reached via routing.
Update the customer session guard redirect to navigate to "/customer/request" instead of "/customer/signin" when no customer session is active.

requirements.summary: Update the customer request success return action so it does not navigate to pages dependent on the removed sign-in flow.
acceptanceCriteria: After submitting a request and seeing the success screen, the return button navigates to a valid page that does not depend on the removed customer sign-in route (e.g., "/" or "/customer/request").
No navigation from the customer request flow leads to "/customer/signin".

file_operations.description: Change the success-screen primary action to navigate to a valid route not dependent on customer sign-in (e.g., "/"). Also update the form "Cancel" navigation to avoid "/customer" if it could trigger a sign-in redirect; ensure no navigation in this flow targets "/customer/signin".
